sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: ReNew Inks Pact With Google For 150-MW Solar Project In Rajasthan
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global Plc has partnered with Google to develop a 150-megawatt solar project in Rajasthan. Google will procure the project's energy attributes, such as carbon credits, which will help Google address its value chain emissions and support the project's bankability. The project, expected to be commissioned in 2026, will generate significant clean electricity, contributing to India's clean energy goals.

feed.title: ReNew Inks Pact With Google For 150-MW Solar Project In Rajasthan
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global Plc has partnered with Google to develop a 150-megawatt (MW) solar project in Rajasthan. Google will procure the project's energy attributes, including carbon credits, which will aid in their value chain emissions targets and ensure the project's bankability. The project, set to be commissioned in 2026, will significantly expand ReNew's commercial and industrial portfolio and contribute to India's clean energy goals.

feed.title: Norges Bank Takes $3.13 Million Position in ReNew Energy Global PLC $RNW
feed.summary: Norges Bank has established a new position in ReNew Energy Global PLC (NASDAQ:RNW), acquiring 452,798 shares valued at approximately $3.13 million. This stake represents about 0.12% of the company at the end of the last reporting period. The stock recently reported earnings, missing EPS estimates but exceeding revenue forecasts, and currently holds a "Hold" consensus analyst rating.

feed.title: AP to Host India’s First 6 GW Solar Ingot–Wafer Manufacturing Unit
feed.summary: Andhra Pradesh is set to host India's first integrated 6 GW solar ingot and wafer production facility in Anakapalli district, with ReNew Photovoltaics investing Rs 3,990 crore. This project aims to significantly reduce India's reliance on imported solar components, support the nation's 2030 renewable energy goals, and create approximately 1,200 jobs. The facility is expected to begin commercial production by January 2028.

feed.title: ReNew Energy Global PLC $RNW Shares Sold by Northwest & Ethical Investments L.P.
feed.summary: Northwest & Ethical Investments L.P. decreased its holdings in ReNew Energy Global PLC (NASDAQ:RNW) by 5.5% in the second quarter, selling 74,548 shares. Despite this, other institutions like UBS AM, Franklin Resources Inc., Millennium Management LLC, and Invesco Ltd. either acquired new stakes or significantly increased their positions, resulting in institutional investors owning 43.56% of the company. ReNew Energy Global missed its consensus earnings estimate for the recent quarter but analysts still maintain a "Hold" rating with a target price of $7.83 for the stock.

feed.title: Tejara Capital Ltd Decreases Stock Holdings in ReNew Energy Global PLC $RNW
feed.summary: Tejara Capital Ltd reduced its stake in ReNew Energy Global PLC by 26.9% in Q2 2025, selling 151,697 shares and now holding 412,512 shares valued at approximately $2.85 million. Despite missing EPS consensus, ReNew Energy Global reported revenue of $433.94 million, exceeding expectations, and maintains an average "Hold" rating from analysts with a consensus price target of $7.83. Institutional investors currently own 43.56% of the company's stock, which has a market capitalization of $2.75 billion.

feed.title: ReNew agrees to $8.15/share buyout offer
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global Plc has accepted an $8.15 per share cash buyout offer from a consortium of four key shareholders, including Masdar, CPP Investments, ADIA's Platinum Hawk, and ReNew chairman Sumant Sinha. The offer aims to delist the company from Nasdaq, where it has underperformed since its 2021 listing. A special committee unanimously recommended the offer after the initial $7.07 per share bid was raised twice.

feed.title: ReNew Energy Global bags score of 83 in S&P Global Corporate Sustainability Assessment
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global Plc (ReNew) announced it achieved a score of 83 in the S&P Global Corporate Sustainability Assessment, placing it in the 93rd percentile globally among energy companies. This marks the first time an India-based energy company has exceeded the 80-point threshold in this respected ESG benchmark. The assessment evaluates environmental, social, and governance performance.

feed.title: ReNew To Invest Rs 60,000 Crore In Entire Renewable Energy Spectrum In Andhra
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global Plc has pledged a fresh investment of Rs 60,000 crore in Andhra Pradesh for various green energy projects, bringing its total commitment in the state to Rs 82,000 crore. These projects include a 6 GW ingot wafer plant, a 2 GW pumped hydro project, a 300 KTPA green ammonia facility, and 5 GW hybrid projects. This investment aims to create 10,000 direct and indirect jobs and help Andhra Pradesh achieve its ambitious renewable energy targets.

feed.title: India's ReNew to invest $9.33 billion in green energy projects in southern state
feed.summary: India's ReNew Energy Global Plc announced plans to invest approximately $9.33 billion (820 billion rupees) in the southern state of Andhra Pradesh to significantly expand its clean energy portfolio. This investment includes solar manufacturing, pumped hydro, battery storage, and green ammonia projects, aiming to support India's goal of doubling its non-fossil fuel power generation capacity to 500 GW. The expansion is expected to create over 10,000 jobs within the state.

feed.title: ReNew Energy Global Plc Adjusts Valuation Amid Strong Financial Performance and Market Outperformance
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global Plc has seen its valuation grade adjusted due to strong financial results, including significant growth in net sales and operating profit in the latest quarter. Despite trading at a premium, the company has outperformed the S&P 500, with a 38.03% return over the past year compared to the S&P 500's 12.65%. Key financial metrics, such as a P/E ratio of 174 and a robust interest coverage ratio, underscore its strong market position and operational capabilities.

feed.title: ReNew Energy Global Plc Experiences Valuation Adjustment Amid Competitive Market Landscape
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global Plc has undergone a valuation adjustment, with a P/E ratio of 174 and a price-to-book value of 2.20. Despite comparison to peers like Brookfield Infrastructure Partners LP, ReNew Energy has shown strong performance with a 33.22% one-year return, outperforming the S&P 500. This highlights its resilience and positioning within a competitive market.

feed.title: ReNew Becomes India’s Highest-Rated Energy Company in S&P Global’s Corporate Sustainability Assessment
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global Plc has achieved a score of 83 in the S&P Global Corporate Sustainability Assessment, making it India’s highest-rated energy company and placing it in the top 10% globally. This recognition highlights ReNew’s leadership in sustainability, with significant improvements in ESG performance and a commitment to driving clean energy transition. The company has demonstrated strong progress in clean energy generation, emissions reduction, water stewardship, and diversity and inclusion.

feed.title: ReNew Energy Receives Enhanced Acquisition Offer from Consortium - TipRanks
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global (RNW) announced an enhanced non-binding acquisition offer from a consortium including Abu Dhabi Future Energy Company PJSC-Masdar and Canada Pension Plan Investment Board. The proposal represents a 15.3% increase from a previous offer and a 41.5% premium over the 30-day average share price. ReNew's Special Committee is currently evaluating the offer, though the outcome of the transaction is not yet assured.

feed.title: ReNew Energy Global (NASDAQ:RNW) Shares Down 3.6% - Here's What Happened - MarketBeat
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global (NASDAQ:RNW) shares dropped 3.6% to $7.69 on Monday, with a significant 65% decrease in trading volume compared to its average. The company reported a strong quarterly earnings beat of $0.16 per share against estimates of $0.11, alongside a return on equity of 8.34% and a net margin of 5.77%. Institutional investors continue to show interest, with 43.56% ownership and recent increases in stakes by firms like Tidal Investments LLC and Corient Private Wealth LLC.

feed.title: Sembcorp to acquire India's ReNew solar unit to boost renewables portfolio
feed.summary: Sembcorp Industries, backed by Temasek, is acquiring ReNew Pvt Ltd's solar energy unit for approximately S$246 million ($190.02 million) to expand its renewable energy footprint in India. This acquisition aligns with India's ambitious clean energy target of 500 gigawatts by 2030, significantly boosting Sembcorp's installed and under-development renewable capacity in the country to 6.9 GW. The acquired ReNew Sun Bright unit operates a 300 MW solar plant in Rajasthan, under a 25-year power purchase agreement.

feed.title: ReNew in talks with global banks to raise $815 million loan
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global Plc, a major Indian renewable energy company, is in discussions with global banks to secure an $815 million loan for refinancing purposes. This five-year facility, expected to be finalized within the next two months, would be one of the largest refinancing deals in the renewable energy sector this year. The Gurgaon-based company generates approximately 9% of India's clean power and is a key player in the nation's rapidly growing renewable energy market driven by Prime Minister Modi's net-zero emissions target.

feed.title: ReNew Energy to set up $2.57 billion solar, wind project in India
feed.summary: ReNew Energy Global announced plans to invest $2.57 billion to construct a hybrid renewable energy project in Andhra Pradesh, India. The project aims to add 2.8 gigawatts (GW) of energy capacity, comprising 1.8 GW solar and 1 GW wind, addressing India's escalating clean energy demands. This initiative supports India's target of achieving 500 GW non-fossil power capacity by 2030, a goal that requires significant capacity additions in the coming years.

feed.title: India's ReNew Energy offered to be taken private in $2.82 billion deal
feed.summary: A consortium of major shareholders, including Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and UAE-based Masdar, has offered to take India's ReNew Energy private in a $2.82 billion deal. The offer of $7.07 per share represents an 11.5% premium to ReNew's closing price on Dec. 10. The proposed privatization aims to provide liquidity to shareholders and potentially lower compliance costs, while also introducing a new state-owned shareholder from the UAE.

feed.title: CPPIB infuses $400 m more in ReNew Power
feed.summary: Canadian Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB) has invested an additional $400 million in ReNew Power, increasing its stake to 31.5% and becoming the largest shareholder. This move follows Goldman Sachs further paring down its stake in the Nasdaq-listed clean energy company. CPPIB now has the right of first offer on Goldman Sachs' remaining shares in ReNew Energy Global Plc.

feed.title: ReNew Appoints New CFO Also Brings in New General Counsel and Chief Growth Officer
feed.summary: ReNew Power, India’s largest renewable energy company, has announced the appointment of a new Group Chief Financial Officer, Chief Growth Officer, and General Counsel to lead its expansion, including into green hydrogen and other clean energy segments. Kedar Upadhye joins as Group CFO, Vikash Jain as Global General Counsel, and Vikram Kapur as Chief Growth Officer, all bringing extensive experience from various top-tier companies. These strategic hires come as ReNew’s gross portfolio has surged by nearly 20% to 12.1 GW, solidifying its position as India's largest utility-scale solar developer.

feed.title: Goldman sells part of stake in ReNew Power's US parent
feed.summary: Goldman Sachs, the largest shareholder in ReNew Power, sold a portion of its stake in ReNew Energy Global Power Plc to Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB) to comply with US regulatory requirements. This transaction increased CPPIB's voting rights and reduced Goldman Sachs' economic interest in the Nasdaq-listed parent company. The sale occurred at a discount to market price and came amidst a stock downturn for ReNew Energy Global Power Plc following its listing.

feed.title: ReNew Power Lists On Nasdaq
feed.summary: ReNew Power, one of India's largest renewable energy producers, debuted on the Nasdaq after completing its merger with U.S.-based blank-check company RMG Acquisition Corp. II. The company received approximately $610 million in net proceeds from the deal, which will help fund its capacity expansion to 18.5 GW by 2025. Institutional investors, including BlackRock and BNP Paribas, are anchoring this investment, with early backer Goldman Sachs Asset Management seeing a dilution in its ownership.
